page.title: 15Local Personalities
page.content: 'Horelands' at Broadford Bridge is the home of B.B.C. orchestral conductor Kenneth Alwyn and his actress wife Mary Law. Nearby lives Sheila Van Damm the former rally driver, of London Windmill Theatre fame. Here too is the home/workshop of Roger Smith, crafts- man in wood, who makes rocking horses and furniture, mainly from oak. He has designed and made the new choir and clergy stalls for Steyning Church, and the new bar at the Elephant and Castle Public House at West Chiltington. A well-known landmark on B.2139 is a small cottage festooned with ironwork and ornaments, where Mr Arnell, an elderly Sussex local, restores genuine old gypsy caravans - sometimes for genuine gypsies! In the garden is a splendid example, once featured in a TVS regional broadcast. Looking from its doorway is a cut-out countrywoman.
